newsitem.title: CANADA: Frost strikes NW Prairie, frost likely SW Manitoba.
newsitem.headline: Frost strikes NW Prairie, frost likely SW Manitoba.

text.p: Alberta's Peace River Valley saw freezing temperatures for several hours Wednesday morning while southwest Manitoba likely saw some frost but not a killing frost, Environment Canada said.
Alberta's High Level region of the Peace River Valley saw temperatures of 2.0 Celsius (35.6 F) at chest level from 0400 CDT to 0500 CDT, meteorologist Steve Smith told Reuters.

Temperatures at High Level then dropped to 1.0 C (33.8 F) at chest level at 0600 CDT then 0.4 C (32.7 F) at 0700 CDT and was expected to remain there or drop further in the following two hours, Smith said.
Temperatures at ground level can be 2.0 to 5.0 C lower than at chest level depending on whether there are insulating clouds, insulating moisture or cooling winds.
The region was dry, without cloud and little wind overnight, Smith said.
Southwest Manitoba's Brandon region reported a low of 3.0 C (37.4 F) at chest level at 0700 CDT.
"We had temperatures of three degrees at Brandon which could cause a bit of frost on the ground but not a killing frost," Smith said.
Fifty percent of spring wheat in that region was combined.
